perturbation.original_text:
6. REMUNERATION
6.1 The Company will pay the Executive a salary of £740,000 and a fixed benefits allowance of £30,000 per annum. The salary (and so far, as is reasonably possible) the benefits allowance will accrue from day to day and be payable in equal instalments in arrears on or around the 25th day of every month, less deductions for income tax and National Insurance contributions and shall be inclusive of any fees receivable by the Executive as a director of any Group Company.
perturbation.changed_text:
6. REMUNERATION
6.1 The Company will pay the Executive a salary, the amount will be determined yearly based on the employee performance. The salary (and so far, as is reasonably possible) the benefits allowance will accrue from day to day and be payable in equal instalments in arrears on or around the 25th day of every month, less deductions for income tax and National Insurance contributions and shall be inclusive of any fees receivable by the Executive as a director of any Group Company.
perturbation.explanation: The original text states a fixed annual salary of £740,000. The changed text introduces uncertainty by stating that the salary amount will be determined yearly based on the employee's performance. This contradicts the fixed amount defined in the original agreement and could create dispute about the actual salary the executive is entitled to.

perturbation.original_text:
15. TERMINATION OF EMPLOYMENT
15.1 The Appointment may be terminated by either party giving the other at least 12 months' notice in writing.
perturbation.changed_text:
15. TERMINATION OF EMPLOYMENT
15.1 The Appointment may be terminated by either party giving the other at least 3 months' notice in writing.
perturbation.explanation: The original text states that either party should provide 12 months written notice of termination, where as the changed text stipulates only 3 months notice is required. This contradiction creates uncertainty about the amount of notice that must be given when either party decides to terminate the agreement.

perturbation.original_text:
11. HOLIDAYS
11.1 The Company's holiday year runs from 1 January to 31 December (the Holiday Year). The Executive is entitled to 25 days' paid holiday in addition to the usual public or bank holidays in England) in every Holiday Year, to be taken at times convenient to the Company.
11.2 No accrued but untaken holiday may be carried forward to the next holiday year and will lapse unless the Executive has been prevented from taking holiday due to sickness or statutory family leave to which he is or may be entitled further to Company policy from time to time.
perturbation.changed_text:
11. HOLIDAYS
11.1 The Company's holiday year runs from 1 January to 31 December (the Holiday Year). The Executive is entitled to 15 days' paid holiday in addition to the usual public or bank holidays in England) in every Holiday Year, to be taken at times convenient to the Executive.
11.2 Accrued but untaken holiday may be carried forward to the next holiday year up to a maximum of 5 days, regardless of the reason for not taking them.
perturbation.explanation: The original text states that the executive is entitled to 25 days paid holiday per year, and no accrued holiday can be carried over. The modified text reduces the holiday entitlement to 15 days and allows up to 5 days of accrued holiday to be carried over. This directly contradicts the original terms and could lead to disputes about the executive's holiday entitlement and carryover policy.
